stories.title: Imperfect Vaccination Can Enhance the Transmission of Highly Virulent Pathogens

stories.text:
I received an offer at a Series C startup as the "Director Data Science" reporting to VP who reports to C level. Company was pre money ~450M in last round in April. Here are the details:

Salary: 205 Bonus: up to 18% Benefits: Solid affordable health care and "uncapped" vacation Stock: 18k options. No details in offer about the value. But i have access to research and the preferred stock price is around $8.

I'm pretty happy the the title, cash, bonus, and what the company is doing. But i feel that the shares for the responsibility i would have is low. My question is this. One, am i right to think the share amount is low? Two, I have some FANG interviews coming up for Data Science roles. I've been studying LEET code for a while and think i have a good shot. Should i hold out to see what they would offer me?
stories.title: Evaluating Series C Offer
